paper_abstract: Researchers at the Tsinghua University in Beijing propose a mechanism for letting IPA networks communicate with each other across an IPv6 backbone via a Border-Gateway Protocol (BGP)-based control plane for advertising tunnels and IPA network prefixes. They've deployed a prototype implementation on the native-IPv6 China Education and Research Network 2 (CERNet2) backbone as the major part of the China Next-Generation Internet (CNGI) project, using current packet-encapsulation technology and an extension of BGR and the IETF is currently considering their 4over6 mechanism as well.
paper_title: The transition to IPv6, part I - 4over6 for the China Education and Research Network
